The Ability to Access: Accessibility is a broad descriptor generally misapplied to a narrow set of users. Every person has accessibility needs which evolve. It's not just a matter of empathy for those unfortunate enough to have a visible disability. Accessible technologies are good technologies which benefit the able-bodied as much or more as the people they were designed to assist. Here is a selection of links which support that assertion.

column4: Accessibility (often abbreviated to A11y â€” as in, "a", then 11 characters, and then "y") in web development means enabling as many people as possible to use websites, even when those people's abilities are limited in some way.
column5: Not fan of describing accessibility solely in terms of peoples limitations but this resource is fantastic and vital to understanding how to apply assistive technologies in many different ways.
